pullrequest.title: Update the signature of the responser callbacks

content.raw:
I transport 4 using C++11 or C++14?  In c++11 I think this lambda would have a `void` return type. I don't know what visual studio does here, but it is safer to explicitly add the return type to this lambda.

```
     if the body consists of nothing but a single return statement with an expression, the return type is the type of the returned expression (after lvalue-to-rvalue, array-to-pointer, or function-to-pointer implicit conversion);
    otherwise, the return type is void. 
```

http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/lambda

I transport 4 using C++11 or C++14? In c++11 I think this lambda would have a void return type. I don't know what visual studio does here, but it is safer to explicitly add the return type to this lambda.

     if the body consists of nothing but a single return statement with an expression, the return type is the type of the returned expression (after lvalue-to-rvalue, array-to-pointer, or function-to-pointer implicit conversion);
    otherwise, the return type is void.

http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/lambda
